definition: to allow/to grant/in accordance with/in the light of
Bulgaria/Bulgarian/abbr. for 保加利亞|保加利亚[Bao3 jia1 li4 ya4]
to defend/to protect/to keep/to guarantee/to ensure/civil administration unit in the baojia 保甲[bao3 jia3] system (old)

sentences.english: Dave, it's a sure chance to make some money.
sentences.chinese: 戴夫，这是个准保赚钱的好机会。

sentences.english: You can be sure that our team will win.
A letter of introduction will ensure you an interview.
sentences.chinese: 凭一封介绍信准保会接待你。

sentences.english: I'll answer for it that he is in the blind alley.
sentences.chinese: 我准保他在这死胡同里。

sentences.english: If you were at the party , you must have seen Mary .
sentences.chinese: 你如果参加了这次聚会，准保看见玛丽。

sentences.english: The pleasant scent and look of narcissus are also a sure fire way to put a smile on your face.
sentences.chinese: 水仙拥有令人愉快的气味和形象也准保给你带来笑容。

sentences.english: I can assure you that you will observe a vast wasteland.
sentences.chinese: 我准保你看到的是茫茫一片荒原。

sentences.english: This letter will ensure you a hearing.
sentences.chinese: 这封信准保你能获得申诉的机会。

definition: certainly/also written 一準|一准[yi1 zhun3]
more likely than not/quite possible/on the cards
it'd be a wonder if... (following a verb phrase that is usually negative)
contraction of 不用[bu4 yong4]/need not/please don't
I/me/my/(often used in early vernacular literature)
about a hundred/a hundred or so
to have spare time/free from work/it's not important/it's nothing/never mind
vigorously/to the utmost/to the best of one's ability
